sections.title: Usage
sections.content:
libjxl comes with the official encoder/decoder programs: cjxl and djxl. JPEG XL is also supported by imagemagick and ffmpeg. To convert existing formats to jxl (JPEG files are compressed losslessly by default) use:

```
$ cjxl input.jpg lossless.jxl
```

To display image metadata:

```
$ jxlinfo input.jxl
```

Exiftool also supports jxl since 12.25, but might be limited by some metadata that needs to be decoded. --compress_boxes=0 flag can be passed to cjxl to keep metadata uncompressed, making it possible for Exiftool to parse it.

For file de-duplication purposes, it might be desirable to get the checksum of the actual encoded image:

```
$ exiftool -api ImageHashType=MD5 -ImageDataHash
```

sections.title: Support
sections.content:
Browsers:

- Firefox (nightly): set image.jxl.enabled to true in about:config.
- Firefox: Install the JPEG XL viewer extension.
- Chromium support was added in version 91, removed in version 109. Was behind the flag chrome://flags/#enable-jxl.

Image viewers:

- Gwenview: install kimageformats
- nsxiv
- swayimg

Previewers:

- Dolphin: install kimageformats
- ueberzugpp
